main.name: Erik Adames
main.description: I am a full stack software engineer with a background in Supply Chain.
main.bio: My name is Erik Adames and I am a Full Stack Web Developer. I have recently moved to the Bay Area after spending the prior 6 years in Switzerland. While abroad, I led large complex pricing projects involving various teams from around the world. After spending most of my career working in the transportation industry, I decided that a change was required. In 2017, I enrolled in graduate classes at the Harvard University Extension School to obtain a Certificate in Data Science. That was completed in 2019 and the following year I moved to Berkeley, California. To enhance my skillset, I enrolled at the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp offered by University of California Berkeley which was completed in 2020. The bootcamp provided a deep understanding of a variety of computer languages as well as the principles and techniques of website construction and maintenance. My previous work experience help develop my dependable and superb work ethic.

education.degree: Full Stack Web Developer Professional Certificate
education.description: A 24-week intensive program focused on gaining technical programming skills in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Node Js, MySQL, MongoDB, Express, NoSQL, ReactJS and Redux.
Finished the 4-course graduate level certificate with a 3.67 GPA. Relevant Coursework: Statistical Modeling, Quantitative Methods, Elements of Data Science in R, and Remote Sensing Data

education.school: University of North Carolina at Charlotte

work.company: Kuehne and Nagel Inc. - Schindellegi, Switzerland
work.title: Global Projects Pricing Analyst
work.description: The position entailed handling complex pricing projects with teams from different regions of the world. The role required to be the project manager for each assigned project. This involved a project compliance review of the customerâ€™s requirements, communication with project owners and stakeholders, strategy formation, launching, problem-solving, data collection, data cleansing, data analysis, revisions and submission.
